intro: Restio degenerans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white to pale blue flowers. Restio degenerans thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often growing in open, sunny areas. Its foliage is typically narrow and grass-like, contributing to its resemblance to true grasses.
